com.quinsoft.zeidon

Interface SelectSet

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Collection<EntityInstance>, Iterable<EntityInstance>, Set<EntityInstance>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SelectSetImpl

    public interface SelectSet
extends Set<EntityInstance>
    An interface for keeping track of selected entities. This is largely just a Java Set. The main difference is that when an EI is added to the set with select(...) there is an option to also add all of its children.

    • Method Summary

      Removes the entity from the select set.

      Returns true if the entity is selected in this set.

      void select(EntityInstance ei, boolean selectChildren)

      • deselect

        void deselect(EntityInstance ei,
              boolean removeChildren)
        Removes the entity from the select set.
        Parameters:
        ei -
        removeChildren - if true then remove all of the children of ei.

      • eachEntity

        EntityIterator<? extends EntityInstance> eachEntity()
        Iterates over each of the entities in the set in hierarchical order. Note that for large OIs this may be slow because this will loop through all the entities looking for ones that are in the set. To loop through just the entities (without changing the underlying View) then use the standard Set iterator; however this is not guaranteed to loop in hierarchical order.

      • drop

        void drop()
        If this SelectSet is named then this removes the name from the view's list. If it is not named then this does nothing.
